meanings.definition: The quality of being able to change or be changed.
meanings.sent1: Her changeablenesses allowed her to adapt to any situation.
meanings.sent2: The weather's changeablenesses kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon's changeablenesses made it the life of the party.
meanings.sent4: His mood swings were like the changeablenesses of the wind.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of changeablenesses in her painting.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being changeable.
meanings.sent1: The changeablenesses of the market made investing risky.
meanings.sent2: The changeablenesses of the river's flow fascinated the scientists.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's changeablenesses in preferences kept the parents on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The political landscape showed its changeablenesses during the election.
meanings.sent5: The unpredictability of changeablenesses made planning difficult.

meanings.definition: The ability to vary or alter.
meanings.sent1: The chef's changeablenesses in recipes led to unique dishes.
meanings.sent2: The technology's changeablenesses revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent3: The magician's changeablenesses in tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's changeablenesses in strategy kept the opponents guessing.
meanings.sent5: The writer's changeablenesses in style made each book a surprise.
